items.title: Who is Tarique Rahman, the man set to become Bangladesh prime minister?
items.standfirst: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party has secured a historic majority in the first election since PM Sheikh Hasina was ousted
items.content: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party has secured a historic majority in the first election since PM Sheikh Hasina was ousted

items.title: Bangladesh election: BNP wins historic first vote since overthrow of Hasina
items.standfirst: Voting was largely peaceful in an election seen as a test of Bangladesh’s democracy after years of political turmoil The Bangladesh Nationalist party, led by Tarique Rahman, has won a sweeping victory in the country’s first election since a gen Z uprising toppled the autocratic regime of Sheikh Hasina.Results from the election commission confirmed the BNP alliance had won 212 seats, returning the party to power after 20 years, while the rival alliance, led by the Islamist party Jamaat-e-Islami, won 77 seats. Continue reading...
items.content: Voting was largely peaceful in an election seen as a test of Bangladesh’s democracy after years of political turmoil The Bangladesh Nationalist party, led by Tarique Rahman, has won a sweeping victory in the country’s first election since a gen Z uprising toppled the autocratic regime of Sheikh Hasina.Results from the election commission confirmed the BNP alliance had won 212 seats, returning the party to power after 20 years, while the rival alliance, led by the Islamist party Jamaat-e-Islami, won 77 seats. Continue reading...

items.title: Bangladesh Nationalist Party sweeps to victory in first election since Gen Z uprising
items.standfirst: Voters are hoping for a return to democracy after 15 years of authoritarian rule under Sheikh Hasina.
items.content: Voters are hoping for a return to democracy after 15 years of authoritarian rule under Sheikh Hasina.

items.title: Bangladesh’s BNP claims landslide win in first election since 2024 uprising
items.standfirst: Party led by Tarique Rahman says it will form government by Sunday.
items.content: Party led by Tarique Rahman says it will form government by Sunday.

items.title: Who is Tarique Rahman, Bangladesh's election winner ?
items.standfirst: Bangladesh’s BNP wins a decisive majority, with Tarique Rahman set to lead after the 2024 uprising ousted Sheikh Hasina. Returning from 17 years abroad, he pledges unity, aid expansion, and political reforms.
items.content: Bangladesh’s BNP wins a decisive majority, with Tarique Rahman set to lead after the 2024 uprising ousted Sheikh Hasina. Returning from 17 years abroad, he pledges unity, aid expansion, and political reforms.

items.title: Bangladesh's Nationalist Party wins majority in historic election
items.standfirst: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) has secured a majority victory in the country's first election since the Gen Z-driven uprising of 2024.
items.content: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) has secured a majority victory in the country's first election since the Gen Z-driven uprising of 2024.

items.title: Tarique Rahman promises era of clean politics as Bangladesh holds first election since fall of Hasina
items.standfirst: Jailed then exiled in London, Rahman returns home as the main contender to be next prime minister of BangladeshTarique Rahman, who after 17 years in exile is the main contender to be the next prime minister of Bangladesh, has pledged to end entrenched corruption and put the country on a “new path” as voting began in the first free and fair elections in almost two decades.Speaking to the Guardian before polls opened on Thursday morning, Rahman promised a new era of clean politics, including a “top down, no tolerance” approach to graft, if his Bangladesh Nationalist party (BNP) was brought to power. Continue reading...
items.content: Jailed then exiled in London, Rahman returns home as the main contender to be next prime minister of BangladeshTarique Rahman, who after 17 years in exile is the main contender to be the next prime minister of Bangladesh, has pledged to end entrenched corruption and put the country on a “new path” as voting began in the first free and fair elections in almost two decades.Speaking to the Guardian before polls opened on Thursday morning, Rahman promised a new era of clean politics, including a “top down, no tolerance” approach to graft, if his Bangladesh Nationalist party (BNP) was brought to power. Continue reading...

items.title: Three issues that matter to voters in the Bangladesh election
items.standfirst: It's the first election since the 2024 Gen Z uprising that toppled Bangladesh's long-serving prime minister Sheikh Hasina.
items.content: It's the first election since the 2024 Gen Z uprising that toppled Bangladesh's long-serving prime minister Sheikh Hasina.

clusters.title: ICE plans to spend $38.3bn converting warehouses to detention centers, documents show, as DHS shutdown looms – US politics live
clusters.neutral_headline: Why is DHS facing a shutdown? #politics
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, CBS News, Reuters Top News and others

items.title: ICE plans to spend $38.3bn converting warehouses to detention centers, documents show, as DHS shutdown looms – US politics live
items.standfirst: Centers would have capacity for tens of thousands of people to be held; talks over funding bill stall hours before shutdown The annual rate of US inflation eased in January, according to the latest data consumer price index report from the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). Over the last 12 months, the cost of goods has increased by 2.4% – down from 2.7% in last month’s report.Lawmakers in the House and Senate left Washington on Thursday as the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) heads for another shutdown, when stopgap funding lapses tonight. Nearly all Democrats blocked a second attempt to pass the annual DHS appropriations bill as negotiations for guardrails on federal immigration enforcement have stalled. Senator John Fetterman was the only lawmaker to break ranks with the party. Continue reading...
items.content: Centers would have capacity for tens of thousands of people to be held; talks over funding bill stall hours before shutdown The annual rate of US inflation eased in January, according to the latest data consumer price index report from the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). Over the last 12 months, the cost of goods has increased by 2.4% – down from 2.7% in last month’s report.Lawmakers in the House and Senate left Washington on Thursday as the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) heads for another shutdown, when stopgap funding lapses tonight. Nearly all Democrats blocked a second attempt to pass the annual DHS appropriations bill as negotiations for guardrails on federal immigration enforcement have stalled. Senator John Fetterman was the only lawmaker to break ranks with the party. Continue reading...

items.title: Democrats and Republicans remain at odds on DHS funding despite partial shutdown threats
items.standfirst: Lawmakers did not agree on a plan to fund the Department of Homeland Security, setting the stage for another partial government shutdown. CBS News' Nikole Killion and Nicole Sganga report.
items.content: Lawmakers did not agree on a plan to fund the Department of Homeland Security, setting the stage for another partial government shutdown. CBS News' Nikole Killion and Nicole Sganga report.

items.title: US homeland security department on track for shutdown after funding bill fails in Senate
items.standfirst: Lawmakers left Washington for a long weekend without resolving an impasse over much-criticized agency’s fundingUS politics live – latest updatesThe Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is on course for an official shutdown at midnight after lawmakers left Washington for a long weekend without resolving an impasse over the much-criticized agency’s funding.A range of services, including domestic flights and the US Coastguard, could be vulnerable to disruption after the Senate failed on Thursday to clear the 60-vote threshold needed to pass the DHS appropriations bill. Democrats blocked the funding in protest over violent tactics used in the Trump administration’s recent immigration crackdown in Minneapolis. Continue reading...
items.content: Lawmakers left Washington for a long weekend without resolving an impasse over much-criticized agency’s fundingUS politics live – latest updatesThe Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is on course for an official shutdown at midnight after lawmakers left Washington for a long weekend without resolving an impasse over the much-criticized agency’s funding.A range of services, including domestic flights and the US Coastguard, could be vulnerable to disruption after the Senate failed on Thursday to clear the 60-vote threshold needed to pass the DHS appropriations bill. Democrats blocked the funding in protest over violent tactics used in the Trump administration’s recent immigration crackdown in Minneapolis. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Rubio skips Ukraine meeting with European leaders in Munich
clusters.neutral_headline: Merz, Macron to address Munich Security Conference amid disputes with US
bullet_summary: Reported by Financial Times, CBS News, France24 and others

items.title: Rubio skips Ukraine meeting with European leaders in Munich
items.standfirst: US secretary of state cancels attendance at last minute in move that EU official calls ‘insane’
items.content: US secretary of state cancels attendance at last minute in move that EU official calls ‘insane’

items.title: Rubio is meeting with European leaders as Russia war in Ukraine rages on
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio is in Munich, Germany, for a security conference with his European counterparts. CBS News' Olivia Gazis reports.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio is in Munich, Germany, for a security conference with his European counterparts. CBS News' Olivia Gazis reports.

items.title: German chancellor's call to repair transatlantic trust at Munich
items.standfirst: Friedrich Merz urged the United States and Europe to rebuild trust as global tensions grow, arguing that neither side can face today’s challenges alone. Speaking at the Munich Security Conference, alongside Marco Rubio, he called for a renewed transatlantic partnership after a year of strained relations. Those tensions were fuelled by moves from Donald Trump, including tariff threats linked to Greenland. Merz stressed that cooperation through NATO remains essential as great-power rivalry intensifies. FRANCE 24's Nick Holdsworth has the latest from Munich.
items.content: Friedrich Merz urged the United States and Europe to rebuild trust as global tensions grow, arguing that neither side can face today’s challenges alone. Speaking at the Munich Security Conference, alongside Marco Rubio, he called for a renewed transatlantic partnership after a year of strained relations. Those tensions were fuelled by moves from Donald Trump, including tariff threats linked to Greenland. Merz stressed that cooperation through NATO remains essential as great-power rivalry intensifies. FRANCE 24's Nick Holdsworth has the latest from Munich.

items.title: Marco Rubio leads US delegation with warmer tone at Munich summit
items.standfirst: The Munich Security Conference opens in Munich, Germany, with EU‑US relations and NATO cooperation at the forefront after US tensions over Greenland and Ukraine. Secretary of State Marco Rubio leads the US delegation with a warmer, more reassuring tone than JD Vance's last year, while talks will also cover European defence and global security challenges.
items.content: The Munich Security Conference opens in Munich, Germany, with EU‑US relations and NATO cooperation at the forefront after US tensions over Greenland and Ukraine. Secretary of State Marco Rubio leads the US delegation with a warmer, more reassuring tone than JD Vance's last year, while talks will also cover European defence and global security challenges.

items.title: Merz, Macron to address Munich Security Conference amid disputes with US
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and US Secretary of State Marco Rubio will also address the conference.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and US Secretary of State Marco Rubio will also address the conference.

items.title: UK Palestine Action ban ruled unlawful, in humiliating blow for ministers
items.standfirst: Thousands arrested for supporting group since proscription are now in legal limbo as Mahmood says she will appealJudges have humiliated ministers by insisting Palestine Action should not be banned under anti-terrorism laws in a ruling that has left thousands of its alleged supporters in legal limbo.The high court said on Friday the government’s proscription of the direct action group was “disproportionate and unlawful” and that most of their activities had not reached the level, scale and persistence to be defined as terrorism. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump sends second aircraft carrier to Middle East in effort to increase pressure on Iran
items.standfirst: USS Gerald R Ford will take about three weeks to sail to region, amid push for Iran to curb its nuclear ambitionsDonald Trump has ordered the world’s largest aircraft carrier to sail from the Caribbean Sea to the Middle East in an effort to increase pressure on Iran amid discussions over curbing its nuclear and ballistic missile programmes.The USS Gerald R Ford and its supporting warships should take about three weeks to return to the region, where they will join the USS Abraham Lincoln, dramatically increasing the military firepower available to the US leader. Continue reading...

bullet_summary: Reported by France24, NBC World

items.title: #CIA: Video aims to recruit #Chinese military officers as spies
items.standfirst: The #CIA has posted a video on its YouTube channel targeting members of the #Chinese military in an attempt to #recruit them as spies. The video depicts a fictional disillusioned Chinese military officer who decides to contact the CIA and comes after a recent dramatic purge of China's top generals.
items.content: The #CIA has posted a video on its YouTube channel targeting members of the #Chinese military in an attempt to #recruit them as spies. The video depicts a fictional disillusioned Chinese military officer who decides to contact the CIA and comes after a recent dramatic purge of China's top generals.

items.title: China vows to take 'measures' against spying after CIA recruitment video
items.standfirst: The CIA released a Chinese-language recruitment video targeting disaffected Chinese military officers, showing a fictional officer deciding to contact the agency to expose leadership lies. The clip encourages leaks on China’s leaders and military. Beijing reacted angrily, warning it will take all necessary measures to counter foreign espionage.
items.content: The CIA released a Chinese-language recruitment video targeting disaffected Chinese military officers, showing a fictional officer deciding to contact the agency to expose leadership lies. The clip encourages leaks on China’s leaders and military. Beijing reacted angrily, warning it will take all necessary measures to counter foreign espionage.

items.title: CIA makes new push to recruit spies from Chinese military
items.standfirst: The CIA released a new Mandarin-language video on Thursday appealing to members of China’s military to spy for the United States and work toward “a brighter future,” weeks after Beijing ousted a top general as part of a purge of top brass.
items.content: The CIA released a new Mandarin-language video on Thursday appealing to members of China’s military to spy for the United States and work toward “a brighter future,” weeks after Beijing ousted a top general as part of a purge of top brass.

clusters.title: Why did the EPA revoke the endangerment finding? #science
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump revokes landmark ruling that greenhouse gases endanger public health
bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, BBC World

items.title: Why did the EPA revoke the endangerment finding? #science
items.standfirst: What the change does and why it matters The agency's move removes a foundational legal conclusion that greenhouse gases threaten public health and welfare — a determination first issued in 2009 that gave federal regulators the authority to limit emissions from vehicles, power plants and other…
items.content: What the change does and why it matters The agency's move removes a foundational legal conclusion that greenhouse gases threaten public health and welfare — a determination first issued in 2009 that gave federal regulators the authority to limit emissions from vehicles, power plants and other…

items.title: What did the EPA revoke and why it matters #science
items.standfirst: What changed and why it matters The agency withdrew the 2009 scientific determination that greenhouse gases ‘‘endanger’’ public health and welfare — a finding that for years served as the legal foundation for federal rules limiting emissions from vehicles, power plants and industry. Removing that…
items.content: What changed and why it matters The agency withdrew the 2009 scientific determination that greenhouse gases ‘‘endanger’’ public health and welfare — a finding that for years served as the legal foundation for federal rules limiting emissions from vehicles, power plants and industry. Removing that…

items.title: Trump revokes landmark ruling that greenhouse gases endanger public health
items.standfirst: The White House calls it the largest deregulation in US history, but environmentalists say it will prove costly for Americans.
items.content: The White House calls it the largest deregulation in US history, but environmentalists say it will prove costly for Americans.

items.title: Why revoke the 'endangerment finding'? #science
items.standfirst: What the decision does and why it matters The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has rescinded its 2009 determination that greenhouse gases endanger public health and welfare — a legal finding that for years provided the scientific basis for U.S. limits on carbon pollution. That 2009 conclusion…
items.content: What the decision does and why it matters The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has rescinded its 2009 determination that greenhouse gases endanger public health and welfare — a legal finding that for years provided the scientific basis for U.S. limits on carbon pollution. That 2009 conclusion…

clusters.title: US military completes transfer of thousands of Islamic State detainees
clusters.neutral_headline: More than 5,000 ISIL detainees transferred from Syria, says Iraqi ministry
bullet_summary: The US military has completed the transfer of thousands of Islamic State (IS) detainees from Syria to Iraq, the US Central Command has said
Reported by Sky News World, Al Jazeera

items.title: US military completes transfer of thousands of Islamic State detainees
items.standfirst: The US military has completed the transfer of thousands of Islamic State (IS) detainees from Syria to Iraq, the US Central Command has said.
items.content: The US military has completed the transfer of thousands of Islamic State (IS) detainees from Syria to Iraq, the US Central Command has said.

items.title: More than 5,000 ISIL detainees transferred from Syria, says Iraqi ministry
items.standfirst: Iraq says more than 3,000 Syrians are among the ISIL-linked detainees transferred to one of its prisons by US military.
items.content: Iraq says more than 3,000 Syrians are among the ISIL-linked detainees transferred to one of its prisons by US military.
